body_html:
Maybe not updating tf-tensorboard.html was a better idea. Should it be updated in sync with the .ts, or should I leave it unchanged?

[Edit] BTW, I should point out I didn't machine-generate tf-tensorboard.html from vz-line-chart.ts using gulp. I tried following the instructions in the DEVELOPMENT.md file in the tensorboard directory, but ran into a problem with npm, which apparently hanged. So I just manually hacked the javascript changes directly into tf-tensorboard.html, and that worked. I think they're equivalent. But I've never actually touched any js before. It looked kind of C-like, so I went with it. So if you are tempted to accept this PR, I trust that whoever you are at the GOOG will run gulp or whatever and check that this change actually works when the html file is generated from the assets. Or perhaps give me a pointer and I could have another go at it. Thanks.

body:
Maybe not updating `tf-tensorboard.html` was a better idea. Should it be updated in sync with the .ts, or should I leave it unchanged?

[Edit] BTW, I should point out I didn't machine-generate `tf-tensorboard.html` from `vz-line-chart.ts` using gulp. I tried following the instructions in the DEVELOPMENT.md file in the tensorboard directory, but ran into a problem with npm, which apparently hanged. So I just manually hacked the javascript changes directly into `tf-tensorboard.html`, and that worked. I _think_ they're equivalent. But I've never actually touched any js before. It looked kind of C-like, so I went with it. So if you are tempted to accept this PR, I trust that whoever you are at the GOOG will run gulp or whatever and check that this change actually works when the html file is generated from the assets. Or perhaps give me a pointer and I could have another go at it. Thanks.
